comment.author: 82096028@N00
comment._content:
Showing is spelt wrongly!

Sudanese is spelt in an unusual way! 

Tag says Suakin - description says Suakim - which is correct?

comment.author: 13007280@N00
comment._content: Shew is an archaic spelling of show and is probably how the original description was written.

comment.author: 51107441@N00
comment._content: The obsessive comments about spelling are tedious. I've known many photographers for whom spelling was - shall we say - not the number one priority. And "shewing" is, in any case, not mis-spelt, as a knowledge of Victorian literature would shew.

comment.author: 51107441@N00
comment._content:
But what I actually wanted to say before being irritated by a previous comment is how wonderful it is to see these old photos. The light they show on architecture and the life of those days is fascinating.

Anyway, the real problem with this photo is not the spelling, it is that Beato didn't bother to level his camera properly!

comment.author: 82096028@N00
comment._content:
Paul

You are easily irritated!

It seems to me a reasonable expectation that the National Archives would make the effort to maximise accessibility of these pictures with correct labelling and tagging.

If you could be bothered to look at my other comments, you will see what I mean.

comment.author: 51107441@N00
comment._content:
I did look at your other, repetitive comments, that's what made it so irritating, Some of your complaints aren't even accurate (and the collection has explained that it is simply following the original captions). 

Perhaps they should convert everything standard American spellings, since that dominates the internet?

comment.author: 82096028@N00
comment._content:
Paul 

Not sure what the American reference is about? 

By the way I passed through Doha the other day - it looked like a reasonably nice place from the air. Loved the old Hawker Hunter parked at the end of the runway!

comment.author: 51107441@N00
comment._content:
Just that you are objecting to spellings because they are out of date, the internet is likely to make English English out of date soon. Words and place names change.

Doha's OK. It's a bit boring if you're not obsessed with sports and big buildings. The airport doubles as the Air Force base which is why the Hunter is displayed there, I suppose. If you are seen trying to take a photo of it they will arrest you.

comment.author: 53257398@N07
comment._content:
To answer some of the questions:
Suakin is the proper modern spelling, but in previous times it was sometimes spelt Suakim.  Also, note that tags can be added by the public.
The words 'Sudanese' and 'Show' also had variant forms.

comment.author: 44006811@N05
comment._content: This image helped to make the description of the most outstanding landmarks in Sudan by Wondermondo. Thanks to all who helped to make it happen!
